title: How I view non-Level 30 Beginner players in League nowadays....

replies.body:
Playing Lee Sin without runes
Good luck
Aren't early game champs the best to be runeless on, in particular in the jungle?

Honestly, I wouldn't say so.

If they are early-game champions, then they generally need to pressure the map early before they are outscaled by their opponents.

If you are clearing without runes, then you will clear far slower and have less health when you finish.  As such, you will have a much harder time pressuring opponents early-game.

If you need to play a jungler without having runes, I would recommend the following options:
{{champion:20}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:2}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:154}}

> [{quoted}](name=EndlessSorcerer,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=QAskWG6v,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2016-11-04T17:25:01.441+0000)
>
> Honestly, I wouldn't say so.
> 
> If they are early-game champions, then they generally need to pressure the map early before they are outscaled by their opponents.
> 
> If you are clearing without runes, then you will clear far slower and have less health when you finish.  As such, you will have a much harder time pressuring opponents early-game.
> 
> If you need to play a jungler without having runes, I would recommend the following options:
> {{champion:20}} {{champion:9}} {{champion:19}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:2}} {{champion:90}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:154}}

Don't forget {{champion:35}}
Clearing jungle on Shaco without runes is a pain.

> [{quoted}](name=Draqone,realm=EUW,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=QAskWG6v,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-04T20:47:53.602+0000)
>
> Clearing jungle on Shaco is a pain.

ftfy
what does ftfy mean?
ftfy = fixed that for you
thanks

dont feel bad. i thought it meant fifty and was a ghetto way of saying "money" or something or at the very least like a basketball call out to 50 cent sort of how people go "ballin" when they do a fancy layup or something.

people seemed to always use it in a way that made it seem like they were proud of their mistakes. fix that for you is completely different than what i expected.

on a side note i hate when people say "what's popping/cracking/up/etc. and sup etc. it triggers me for some reason - most likely because it makes absolutely no sense in context. so in retaliation im going to start a new trend right now  using the phrase - "sup yeah?" as a new form of what's up and what's cracking as a way to laugh at people for how ridiculous they sound with their fancy ways of saying hi.
its micro intensive, but not really that slow. i know because i tried scaling health runes on shaco before which is pretty much no runes
{{champion:20}} {{champion:19}} are getting major reworks. Wait to see those before we say this indefinitely.

{{champion:11}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:11}} 
unless your level 8 opponent contests blue buff lol

No. Farm junglers are the best without runes since they can scale and won't go as low on the jungle. Early game champs will be able to clear the jungle but won't have enough HP  left to gank and hence will lose their edge (the early game) and become useless late. Tanks won't survive the camps. Get famrer junglers that scale with time.
Am I the only one who plays without runes????
I only have half a tank rune page. I don't play enough to grind up for runes.

I'd hope so, sadly I think you're not.
You really should get runes, they make a huge difference. Same goes for proper item builds and masteries, these things are all part of the game and unless you want to be bad at the game you should learn these things.

I mean, I know builds and masteries, runes are just so damn expensive and I'm never sure if they're gonna get remade when the new client comes out or just removed, so I don't buy any.

Guess I will then.

You have a fair point there I guess, I'd probably save up your IP then until it's announced what happens in season 7, because I have heard they wanted to change something about it soon (might be completely off here).
And as you've already played without runes for a while you might as well continue for another month or so if it can save you a lot of IP/time. But I'd definitely save up IP in that case so you can get all your runes when it's announced nothing changes.

You could also get tier 2 runes, they cost 1 IP each and they're weak compared to tier 3 but still great compared to nothing, 60 IP for 2 rune pages really is nothing :P.
Well I mained Lee jungle when i was lvling my account years ago. It worked since his W gave him load of armor back then :D. I dont think it would work so well now tho :Z.
Pre-level 30 there is a Teemo In every game. Every. Single. Game.
Lol that how felt about pre 30 games but then I laugh because those players think teemo is good.
He is decent actually.
That's subjective i saw Teemo and Old Yorick mains in Diamond or Master.
In soloQ to climb you need 2 things: not trolling and dedicating enough time, this is why rank at the end of the day doesn't mean anything.
uhhh wtf? what do you mean? I must be confused because that sounded legit retarded to me.... anybody else?
I have more than 500 ranked games , i dont troll , still silver

You're welcome.
Lol , you think i don't watch streams ? Climbing requires time ( which i don't have rn) , patience and improvement and luck, simply watching streams and taking notes won't make me Diamond.

Exactly what i said in my original post then.
I'm glad to see we agree on the same point.
Eh, he csn be pretty strong if you don't know how to deal with him. One of the reasons he's so popular with brand new players, I imagine.
This, I think he is a garbage champ but I still respect his early game facing him because his 1-3 is pretty strong.

{{champion:17}} is situational just like any other champ, some match-ups are great while others are the worst. It also depends on the play style of the player and the items one builds. HAIL SATAN!!!!!!{{champion:17}}
The reason i hate teemonso much , Was a toplane main before lvl 30
Show'em Urgot and Yorick.

No don't show them Yorick he's....*Viable*

Don't tell anyone about Yorick, there can be only one Yorick main......

Well... I just started playing and am currently level 6. I finished the battle training and it instantly gave me enough currency to buy the samurai. I have been performing decently, only losing one match out of six. I have noticed a trend. People can´t be nice to each other. It seems like people are mentally impaired indeed. Their behaviour is atrocious.

don't mind the community seriously , when i was a  newbie i always asked '' why the hell are these people so rude why the f are they insulting me ? what wrong did i do ? '' 
thee best thing  to do is mute them   
tab > you find the at the top right side of each player's name.

According to every League player, about 90% of the champion pool is toxic/retarded as long as they are average - decent with them.

With the exception of Yasuo, somehow even Riven isn't hated that badly anymore. Propably because Riven's itemization isn't that bad.

> With the exception of Yasuo, somehow even Riven isn't hated that badly anymore. Propably because Riven's itemization isn't that bad.

Part of me suspects that Yasuo stole a sizable portion of the Riven fan base.

One of my friends in Bronze calls so many champions OP.

Examples : {{champion:55}} {{champion:17}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:23}}  and more

Well, jax is not OP as he has clear windows where he can be countered and his late game isn't as amazing as when randuin gave 70 armor but he's not garbage like those champs, thankfully kata gets the rework...

I actually ban Trynda sometimes, being silver. Not because it's a good champ but because a half decent trynda is so frustrating to deal with. 

Random level 2 crits early and lategame this 5 second cd on the spin is aaaarggghhhh.

Teemo, singed, shaco, trynda and to some degree yasuo are champs that make it not fun even if you are winning against them.

For the longest time, I had no idea how to counter Trynd. No matter what I played, I could never beat him.

But then I took Morde top against a Trynd one day.........

Oh, it was glorious. I had finally found my counter to Trynd, and I ended up maining Morde top for quite awhile.......until the rework. (sigh).

He was such a fantastic top laner....at least in the lower elos since no one knew how to fight him. If only Riot embraced that.
When I was pre-lv 30 (late season 4) I mained Kha'Zix. What does that make me?

this is super basic ms paint black and white, and I've still gotten more excited over this than tons of other stuff I've seen lately.

Maybe it's the use of the word retard
